info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 26 at 8:12PM MST until September 26 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff AZ
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall earlier today is occurring.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Arizona, including the following county, Yavapai in the Paulden area.
* WHEN...Until 1100 PM MST.
* IMPACTS...Flooding along Big Chino Wash is occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 805 PM MST, the public reported flooding in the advisory area. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Mud Tank Wash, Granite Creek, Verde River, Pine Creek, Indian Springs Wash, Antelope Wash, Big Chino Wash, Walnut Creek, Little Chino Valley and Williamson Valley Wash. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Paulden. - This includes State Route 89 between mile markers 334 and 336. Flooding has also been reported on Curtis Ranch Road, Rocky Rd, Big Springs Ranch Rd, and other roads in the Paulden area that cross Big Chino Wash. - Additional information is available at weather.gov/flagstaff.
info.instruction:
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Low water crossings will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING
